cons: You are going to be underpaid. They will promise you that it will get better but it won't.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: This is a start-up that is growing up!
pros: This is a company with a great story. It has gone from start-up to 1000 people in rapid pace. Strong growth and profitable. It has people around the world so is very diverse. It has a relaxed culture and is profitable. It is very flexible and has great benefits (yoga classes, fresh fruit etc.). Just such a nice company to work in. If people haven't worked somewhere else they will not appreciate this!
cons: As a fast growing business it has underinvested in some of the infrastructure (IT, buildings and some people). But this is being put right by the senior team. It is in a period of change; but that's great for learning and growing!

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: So much potential, so many problems!
pros:
Great CEO with excellent vision for the future
Product pipeline
Friendly atmosphere
cons:
Middle management
Lots of dead wood
Lack of necessary scientific qualifications / training among employe
Strong growth causing organizational / structural problems
Salary

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Immature company needs to become corporate rapidly
pros:
The people in a personal capacity are lovely. 
The company knows it needs to change and is trying to do something about it. 
Fruit deliveries a few times a week.
cons:
No induction process worth talking about.
Poor technology, recycled laptops. 
No work life balance. 
Going through change, but very challenging, company needs to be more corporate but people aren't on board for change. 
Management do not have the skill set to make key decisions. Company isn't structured in a way that is beneficial. No authority figure. 
No support/mentor structure worth speaking about. 
People in senior positions/line managers aren't sufficiently skilled enough to be managers or to have subordinates. 
Poor support network. Staff overworked. Even when highlighted- nothing is done to improve. 
Losing good long term members of staff. Loss of knowledge. 
Too invested in the old ways of working and legacy systems. Change resistant. 
Employ too many contract/temp workers who aren't invested in the change.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great people, shallow/outdated tech stack
pros: Great atmosphere, great people, very strong planning, a good place to learn the ins and outs of the software development life cycle.
cons: Technical ceiling is relatively low compared to other companies and the salaries or not great. Not a great deal of room to grow.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great company to work for, but lack of traditional ladder
pros:
The people are superb. No 'remit culture' with people sticking to their specific tasks; everyone wants to get involved in projects if they can add something - in Marketing, any way. 

Management are eager to try things, and seem invested in pushing their teams to achieve.

Social life is good, but don't expect it to come to you. Making connections and meeting as many colleagues as possible will always give you a night somewhere each week.
cons:
Office spaces leave a lot to be desired, however they are building a completely new HQ within 3 years.

Hard to know what the next logical career step is. But they are trying to change this! Too many managers.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Supply chain Admnistrator
pros: Abcam is nice company, friendly environment and it get better and better every year.
cons: Abcam really cares about Employees, giving the chance to proceed the career and also giving the chance to join different kind of  trainings

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Rewards are low
pros:
Co-workers are all pleasant and hard working.
Free fruit and drinks in the kitchens
Flexible working
cons:
The pay is low and you have to fight for a fair salary
Workload is heavy with very tight deadlines
The work is generally a bit chaotic and disorganised
Too many managers
High turnover of staff (due to poor pay)

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good for entry level
pros: Lots of training and development opportunities if you are new manager or in a junior position. Growing company with internal opportunities arising. You always work with many departments, not  in isolation. Growing company.
cons: Poor salaries for an stressful environment. No career path defined for many middle roles . If you are not working on the next shinny thing, it is hard to get free resources.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great place to work with some amazing people and build a career
pros: There are some extremely talent people here - the calibre of talent right across the organisation is extremely high and it definitely brings out the best in everyone. It's a very autonomous environment, which I appreciate doesn't suit everyone, but for me this is exactly what I need. The investment in things like facilities, IT, systems and technology is great to see. There is a lot of excitement about the future and with the growth there are lots of opportunities for strong performers - if you join with the mindset that the only limit to development is yourself I think you'll go a long way.
cons: The only constant at Abcam is change! This definitely doesn't work for everyone and it can be tiring sometimes (although fun too). There are some obvious growing pains but this to to be expected with a business at this stage of growth.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great Mix of People and interesting work in a company growing up
pros:
- Interesting Work and Bright, Intelligent People
- Warm and Friendly culture, people are welcoming and will always help
- Loads of social activity - games nights, wellbeing events, team evenings out
- Very little hierarchy or politics
- Very global organisation and a chance to work with people from lots of backgrounds
- Pace of change is very fast
- Company is growing up and investing more in facilities, systems and people.
cons:
- Current Cambridge UK Office is getting a bit tired but are relocating next year to the Biomedical Campus in a new building
- The pace of change can be relentless
- It's still a medium sized company, so whilst there are good career opportunities, it won't be the same as somewhere like GSK or AZ

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good Culture, Uncompetitive Renumeration
pros: Friendly people, relaxed culture, growing company with big plans for the future so exciting to be a part of. Share scheme is a big plus, but also locks you in.
cons: Lack of transparency over progression, and not competitive salaries compared to other companies based in Cambridge.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good working conditions, poor pay
pros: Very friendly and open company
cons: Remuneration package isn't competitive compared to others in the area. Yearly pay reviews are also extremely poor. The company tends to bring in external people and pay them big money rather than incentivising their current employees to stay.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: They try to be a big Company but they aren't
pros: People, environment, culture and flexibility,
cons: Pay, benefits, lack of opportunities, bad decisions made by management

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Just a great company!
pros: This is a wonderful place to work. Some of the negative reviews here are clearly from some lower performers who have not made it. The company is a fun, empowering and trusting organisation with great opportunities to develop. This is a successful and growing place where you can grow skills and your career. For some people who want to coast along; this is not for them.
cons: As a fast growing business some of the infrastructure for a scaled business has been later coming. The company is investing in things to put right years of under investment. These are now appearing and are brilliant.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Transformation
pros:
Some great individuals 
New office is being built
Some of the leadership team are great
Manageable workload most of the time
The social committee and a few employees are always trying to improve morale, but it seems like a very thankless task
cons:
Lots of silo working
Rapidly becoming a slow-moving corporation as opposed to agile innovator 
No development road or managers willing to push you forward - most managers actually struggle developing as well, so their focus is on themselves

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Gray positive place to work
pros: I’ve been working for Abcam for the last 2 months and I thoroughly enjoy working here. Your ideas are always listened to and actioned. It’s very flexible and forward thinking. Everyone is very positive and the team go out for lunches every month!
cons: I can’t think of many so far, only issue is that the car park can get quite full so make sure you arrive earlier to get a space!

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Avoid IT careers at Abcam
pros: Reasonable first job for graduates.
cons: Uncompetitive salary. Poor career development prospects. Catastrophic strategic decision making.  Not enough planning, procedure, or structure. Management doesn't listen. Abcam's once positive culture is rapidly turning sour.

headline: Not sure
pros: good career opportunities, some really nice people, you get to learn more than whats in your contract, amazing what they do as a company, you can see its future growing bigger and better
cons: some of the people are just horrible, they take advantage of your weaknesses

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Fantastic company
pros: The culture of the organisation allows people to collaborate and work well together to achieve great results fast. The company is rapidly expanding and provides huge opportunities to develop and be part of an exciting journey.
cons: Can move too fast on occasions but that's also part of the excitement.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Lovely people, lack of management
pros: The people make the company. Great work life balance and keen on flexible working.
cons: Seem to lack direction and alot of instability within the SLT, especially within IT. Not much room for career progression.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great Company, Fantastic employees. I'm proud to work for Abcam
pros: No company is perfect, and Abcam certainly has its share of frustrations, but look beyond these and you see a collaborative environment where you get to work with fantastic colleagues. Abcam has been on an amazing journey for 20 years and the future looks  just as exciting.
cons: Can rush into new projects without being fully capable.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great company to work for, good place to be for a UI developer
pros: Environment is friendly and relaxed, it's a big company so it gives stability,, benefits, shares... everyone's opinion is taken into account. In the end is up to you how much effort you want (or can) put in your career.
cons: Salaries are not bad but it's not a pro. Depending on roles/teams, sometimes is difficult to get a promotion, you can still get a good raise but maybe not as good and with no change in your responsibilities.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: An inspiring company to work for!
pros: The organisation is growing rapidly and that makes it an exciting place to work with many opportunities as a result.  Leadership have a clear vision and strategy which filters through to all departments so globally we are all one team.
cons: The organisation is very fast paced and has grown significantly and therefore has transformed into a more corporate company - however it is necessary to achieve company goals and the overall culture has been retained.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Poor salaries and employees are expendable.
pros: I worked with a wonderful team and had a fantastic  manager ( who was made redundant just after coming back from maternity leave).
cons:
Expendability of staff: I was made redundant from 
Abcam several years ago. I have since seen many friends and colleagues also made redundant for very little reason. We’re not talking huge lay offs each time, we’re talking about picking people off one or two at a time. Every one of these people I’m glad to say have moved onto very successful careers showing that their talent was unrecognised by this supposedly forward thinking company.

Salaries: I had not realised just how poor the compensation package is at Abcam until I left.

job_title: Head of Technology, R and D
location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A rapidly growing company, fun and intense at times
pros:
Excellent colleagues and a company ambition to go places means there's no shortage of opportunities at abcam. 
HR are broadly supportive, sensitive and helpful when it comes to getting training or even switching careers within the company.
If you are proactive, you can often use the growing environment to get on board many different projects and grow your skill set.
The company isn't big enough to become siloed as yet, you can get insight into multiple business areas very easily.
Generally a positive work culture.
cons: Change is a constant at this company, that can be difficult to manage at times. On that subject I'd note that this area of the biotech industry doesn't have deep pockets and budgets can be tight; expect that to factor into moves or moving on eventually.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Nice company to work for
pros: The people were for Abcam are amazing. Friendly, multicultural.
cons: Too much bureaucracy. The pay is not the best in the area.

location: Cambridge, South West England, England, England
headline: Fab Company, Great Culture and Lovely Employees
pros:
Great Culture
Listen to everyone, no matter experience or level
Great first job
cons:
inflexible job role 
Culture changing slightly as company grew
Would have liked more opportunity to move inter-departmentally, as then I wouldn't have left.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great purpose, vision and culture
pros:
Abcam is a company with a strong sense of purpose; the focus on our customers, and the impact we can have on research, is at the heart of everything. It is a growth business with an exciting vision, and because of this the enviroment is exciting, fulfilling and full of opportunites to make a difference. It is fast paced and active, and challenging (in a good way!).
I am fairly new and have found people very welcoming and friendly. I have met lots of kind, commpassionate people here, and I think there is a good culture of trust. 
In my view, one of the other great things about Abcam is the leadership - I think our CEO is outstanding.
cons:
If you are not comfortace with fast pace, and dealing with change, then I think you would struggle at Abcam.
The facilities in our current office are not very modern - but we are soon moving to a new building so this will change.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good mission poor environment
pros:
- The vision and mission is what drives everyone that works at Abcam with customer success stories helping maintain motivation through difficult times
- The CEO has taken the company to new levels and there's a real confidence in him to continue this trend
- A very flexible company to help with work/life balance
cons:
- Pay is very low unless senior management.
- Senior management (excluding CEO) are awful. Completely disconnected with their employees, hinder everyone's ability to do their job, fail to listen to staffs opinions from staff surveys.
- massive ERP project didn't go well but seems to be the norm with most companies trying to integrate one
- company has turned from an agile one that get's things done to one that wastes lots of time on needless meetings

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Friendly, fun, growing quickly
pros:
Some of the friendliest team mates I've worked with.
The work is interesting
Really approachable managers (CEO replies to every message), not hierarchical
Opportunities for travel in the right job - they have people across the world
Pay has got a lot better. Share benefits are good. 
Flexible on working from home (if you're in the right job)
Great social committee
cons:
We're all just waiting for the new office as the current ones are really old
Lots of worry about travel to the new office
Growing a lot and sometimes hard to know what all the new people are doing
Pension isn't great

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Dedicated, passionate and eager
pros: It’s mission and the CEO; it’s energy and passion for doing more; welcomes new ideas
cons: Work life balance and can be chaotic

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good place to work
pros: Really friendly team. Use of latest technologies.
cons: Feeling some growing pains of its transition from start up to larger company

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good company for entry level jobs
pros: It's a good place to learn and get experience. The work atmosphere is great and there are many young people.
cons: It's difficult to get promoted and there is a big rotation of people because of that, especially in Operations departments like supply chain and customer service.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A career with purpose
pros:
Meet amazing bunch of bright people!
Great team work, everyone pulls together and enjoys helping others!
A shared focus on helping our customers!
Challenging pace and learning new things everyday!
Fantastic new facilities with great coffee!
cons: Due to the fast pace and been a growing company, the way we work is not as structured as it could be.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A vibrant and authentic place to work!
pros:
Abcam really is a lovely company to work in.  Especially now the Cambridge, UK headquarters has moved to the Biomedical Campus at Addenbrooks…the work environment looks and feels much more professional and modern.
A purpose-driven company; with the desire to save lives through medical research.  Whilst that doesn’t necessary show up in every meeting, it does determine the type of people they hire and work with.  Everyone is here to do good work and make a difference, without too much ego.
Very friendly, real, relaxed, yet hard working/fast-paced culture.
A conversation-driven management culture; whereby employees and mangers are encouraged to talk through issues together, rather than email/escalate/document.
A great new office space in Cambridge; lots of non-bookable meeting spaces, some stand-up desks, a fully hot desking environment with personal lockers, showers, towel hire, drying room etc.
Free (good quality) barista coffee & a forward-thinking café with healthy options; menu changes daily.
Currently a VERY attractive share scheme available for all employees.
Dress code is essentially just come as yourself, which means there’s much less bravado/show than other corporates.
cons:
As I understand, Cambridge council want to reduce the number of cars in the city, so Abcam were only allowed a limited car park size for the new building.  This means you don’t get a car parking space every day.  Most people park in one of the park & rides then walk/cycle to work.  
Whilst the Senior Management are far better than most I’ve seen, there are still behaviours that permeate the culture.  They are an ambitious team but that leads to a lot of pressure to deliver magic results.  When things don’t go their way, there is a tendency to blame, rather than take ownership as a leadership team.  It is often up to one or two leaders to shelve the blame, rather than the senior team pulling together.  
The top team can be too quick to judge someone from hero to zero.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Professional, friendly and caring place to work
pros:
Great new state of the art building
Friendly and caring people to work with from all levels
Good mission and vision
Excellent flexibility with great working conditions
Good training opportunities
Good personal benefits
cons: Having only been with the company a few months I haven't come across any cons

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Growing Company
pros:
Revenue growth supporting investment in people and products
Brand new, purpose-built premises
Global and Local opportunities
cons: "Small company" culture is (necessarily) changing to a more "Corporate" environment

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great Company Culture
pros: Although I worked there quite a few years ago. I still have fond memories about the people I worked with. Besides that the ad hoc culture that formed within the company especially centred around the expat community made life in Cambridge way more interesting.
cons: The official company culture seemed a bit artificial.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great place to work!
pros:
The atmosphere is great, very sociable and has a fantastic new HQ! 
Opportunity to shadow and take on new and different tasks that isn't part of your role to learn and progress throughout the company which is good.
cons: Would be great if there are more permanent roles available instead of Fixed Term Contracts and to have the canteen prices subsided for staff.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Welcoming and Enjoyable
pros: Brand new, purpose built, building. Great transport links, even considering the distance from Cambridge Train Station. Fantastic team with great people and a worthwhile set of projects. Great subsidised canteen and barista.
cons: Not enough social activities. More incentives to use greener transport.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great place to work.
pros: The people that work here are very friendly and welcoming, and the business itself is quite nice to work for. Good benefits and a really good share plan.
cons: The current travel and parking situation isn't the greatest, but I'm sure it will improve over time.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Growth is in the DNA of the Company
pros: Great people & Company, with diverse backgrounds and approaches to business and science - that come together under one roof - the result is an organisation that moves at a pace that most businesses aspire to!
cons: nothing different to what you find in any company that is growing insanely fast.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great company to work for
pros:
Abcam has a great culture with everyone being almost universally friendly and collaborative.  There is also a strong focus on work/life balance driven from the CEO down. You are not expected to be on email every minute of every day, with holidays being particularly protected.  

Senior management are also clear that they expect people to do the right thing, not just the right thing for the business, with a focus on ethical and proper behaviour.
cons: There is a broad mix of skills and experience and in some areas the lack of experience can be felt.  Everyone is enthusiastic but this enthusiasm, combined with a lack of experience can sometimes lead to less than preferable outcomes.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great work/life balance!
pros:
Great work/life balance
Very friendly
Enjoyable place to work
Great office/location
Agile working
cons:
Decision making/approval processes slow things down
Lots of people involved in decision making process

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great place to work and grow
pros: Abcam is filled with friendly and dedicated people, it is very motivating to work in an environment where people care and get things done. There are countless opportunities to learn and evolve in your career. Abcam also offers flexible working, an exceptional share plan and in Cambridge has moved to a beautiful new building.
cons: Abcam is very adaptable and therefore things can change very quickly, you need to be able to keep up.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great place to work
pros: Great life sciences company. Really friendly. Abcam offers flexible working and option to work form home. Good work/life balance
cons: Cannot think of any cons.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A talented company full of talented individuals
pros: Culture, people, developing talent, collaboration, global, agile, audacious, inspiring, location, environment, rewarding
cons:
Vulnerable to bigger companies
Location (limited by car parking restriction)
Fast expansion means a fast paced changing environment which may not be for all

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Friendly culture and great work life balance
pros: Culture and purpose really is at the centre of the business. A friendly, fun and balanced culture is really endorsed and nurtured in the business. They also have a clear and meaningful purpose and are driven to continue to facilitate and support the science community in making strides in treatment and diagnosis discoveries! It is also a growing business which leaves lots of room for opportunities to stretch and develop
cons: I can’t think of any at the moment

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: I ❤️ Abcam
pros:
The purpose and the people are inspiring everyday 
We get loads of good stuff done really quickly 
You learn loads and you can develop your career
cons: Rapid growth has thrown up a few challenges in the terms of our systems and processes

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Excellent work/life balance and good place to work
pros: Friendly, supportive and approachable people. Senior management have a clear vision for the company and the new building is fantastic. Wide variety of projects to get involved in; everyone is encouraged to get stuck in. Great work/life balance and working from home is encouraged/expected.
cons: Quite hierarchical with people not at the top feeling excluded from decision-making process. Decision making can also be slow. Pay is low compared to similar companies.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great!
pros:
A clear and efficient recruitment process which is both welcoming and thorough. 
Everybody at abcam is friendly and approachable, and based in a state of the art facility, it is a fantastic environment to work.
cons: None - so far so good

job_title: Human Resources Systems & Human Resources Project Manager
location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great place to learn something new every single day
pros:
Nothing stands still - continuous change and improvement
Great people to work with and very friendly atmosphere
Fantastic new building - pleasure to come to work
Fantastic flexible working across the board
cons: You won't get a car parking space everyday but this depends on how important this is to you.  I just walk and get the exercise from the Park and Ride at Trumpington.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great company, great new office!!
pros: Nice collaborative working environment, with great people and an exciting mission.
cons: None really, its a fast paced company with high ambition which could be a con for some but overall makes it an exciting and evolving place to work.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: In general, I've had a very positive experience.
pros: Flexible working, amazing colleagues, great opportunities. I love the new headquarters.
cons: Tries to grow too much, too fast. Tried to make big changes at once and did not work out very well. Also salaries have historically been on the lower end even though it is a very successful company.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great place to work! lots of opportunities!
pros: Abcam has an extremely nice culture, with a very welcoming attitude. There are plenty of opportunities and ways to develop your own skills. We have a great team of people, all ambitious and willing to help others build and create something special.
cons: Nothing really, its fast paced  - prepared.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Excellent place to begin your career
pros: Fast pace of change and growth means that there are plenty of opportunities to be involved in impactful projects and the development that naturally comes wiht it. Great line managers that care about their team and trust their abilities. Strong friendly culture of inclusivity and desire to meet the companies mission. New HQ is an amazing place to work.
cons: Overstretch resource in key areas and try to tackle too many issues at once.  Investment of time and money into training appears to have halted due to rate of business change / growth. Still repeat prior mistakes on projects. General lack of understanding of systems.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Fast paced, fun and flexible
pros: Very friendly culture, outstanding people, tremendous growth and opportunities. Lots of flexibility. I love the fact that I can make my family life work around my job and that Abcam supports me to do this.
cons: There is very little not to like. There has been a focus on constantly improving reward and benefits which has been very well received and much more is planned in this space

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great place to work!
pros: Abcam is a challenging and dynamic workplace with great progression opportunities. It's fulfilling to be working collectively to help achieve the company goals. The new HQ building is also a great place to work with fantastic facilities.
cons: Abcam is growing at quite a pace and has been for a number of years. Therefore, especially in busy periods, teams will become quite strained by the amount of workload. if you thrive in a fast-paced and changeable environment, then Abcam may be the place for you!

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Amazing company going places
pros: Great atmosphere; friendly and supportive co-workers; interesting work and many opportunities to develop my career; lots of traing and encouragement for self development; amazing building; fast paced and exciting buzz; flexible working encouraged
cons: a lot of change as we grow; new finance system just gone live so a lot to learn; can be long hours at peak times

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Wonderful Company
pros:
Positive mission to help life scientists
Relaxed and friendly company culture
Senior management strongly support the use of data and insights across the business
cons: There are so many exciting projects underway, it is easy for us to get distracted and leave things unfinished.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Good Culture
pros: Good culture, Nice building, Friendly Staff, Good management
cons: IT systems are just awful

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Exceeded Expectations, Continues To Do So
pros: The culture of care is amazing here. Everyone from line managers right up to the tippy top CEO actually care about their employees. Abcam is also pretty well funded so, unlike other companies, you're not cutting important resources just to make budget each month. Also, if you're in the Cambridge site, you get to work in a gorgeous building that's full of eco-friendly features.
cons: The only one I can think of is not being able to drive to work every day. But honest, that works for me.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great company to work for
pros:
The culture and people at Abcam are amazing. It is a fun environment with so many treats and perks such as free fruit, a games room and not forgetting our very own Barista making us fresh coffee in our fabulous cafe Mollys. 
We have an Agile working policy meaning we can work elsewhere at times making life just that little bit easier. 
The investment in development and training for employees is a huge bonus giving everyone opportunities to grow. I have worked at Abcam for a long time and developed my career with support and guidance from amazing Managers who have believed in me and my abilities.
cons: Being on the biomedical campus at Addenbrookes has its disadvantages depending on where you live due to the volume of traffic coming into Cambridge. This is dependent on what time you come into the office though. Abcam has a car park for ~140 card with ~450 employees in the building so we only get to park at the building about 7 times a month. Alternative options must be used such as the park and rides and buses. This was annoying when we first moved to the new building but now I have my new routine I don’t even think of it.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Abcam
pros: Great company with fantastic people.
cons: Parking can be a challenge

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Forward thinking, flexible employer
pros:
Flexibility (work from home a few days a week). 
No set break/lunch etc so you are treated like an adult. 
Great restaurant on site. 
Great, positive culture.
cons: Car parking, park and ride nearby is annoying!

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: You can really make a difference at this company with a difference!
pros: Fantastic values which are truly lived. Despite the company's success there is a 'glass is half empty' mentality - a culture of constantly learning and striving to do the extraordinary.
cons: Grew up quickly so in some areas structure and processes are catching up! But everyone has the opportunity to shape these.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Great opportunities to grow, amazing people to learn from
pros: If you like a challenge and fast-paced environment, this is the place to be
cons: Sometimes feels like we are growing too fast - not enough resource, not being looked after well enough

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Brilliant company to work for
pros:
This is a company that truly lives it’s values, you can feel the positive company culture whether you are working in the office or connecting with colleagues remotely. 

Management truly want to see you succeed and develop and encourage responsibility early on in your career.

The office in Cambridge is great and the food in the canteen is pretty good too.

The benefits and pay are good with plenty of options to choose from. The employee share scheme is also really generous with the company matching what you contribute by 10x. 

Overall great company that I am really happy to be a part of.
cons:
Hot desking in the office can sometimes mean you don’t get an office in your departments area if you arrive at the office a bit later.

There isn’t a bonus scheme for all employees.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Fast-paced, exciting & purposeful
pros:
High-growth, rapidly evolving business - no two days are the same
Supportive culture - freedom to operate & innovate
Purposeful work - we help life scientists to develop tomorrow's medicines
cons: Being high-growth and rapidly evolving, scaling the business in step with that is a constant challenge - one that Abcam mostly gets right though inevitably there are moments where alignment is quite there

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Amazing place to work
pros: Exciting industry to be in - fast growth, ambitious strategy but purpose led. At the moment it is people first with full support to ensure safety and well being. Open communication from ELT. Great culture.
cons: Potential shareholder conservatism could slow the rate of change.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Perfect start to a job
pros: Organised, friendly, welcoming, ethical, growing
cons: Can't think of any cons

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Inspirational Leadership
pros:
The business has handled COVID-19 brilliantly. From our colleagues in China/AsiaPac through to EMEA and US
Inspirational Leadership from CEO and ELT
cons: No cons from my point of view

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great place to work where you feel appreciated and valued!
pros: There is autonomy and freedom within the business to bring in and execute your own ideas, this is refreshing to see. Implementing your own ideas is very much a way of working here and it's can do approach. If you are one to sit back and let others do the work then it's probably not the best place for you. Abcam's growth plans are exciting and bring optimism about where it sees itself in the future, certainly an exciting time to be on board. The company looks out for its employees and there are many perks that are provided including the share scheme, high street discount and the occasional free ice cream
cons: As a company that is growing and will be a very large organisation in years to come, I believe we sometimes think we are larger than we are currently. However this mentality is quite generic in all businesses across the corporate world.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Exciting, challenging and dynamic! A great place to work.
pros:
Cares about its employees. Encourages a good work-life balance. Good benefits.
Good opportunities to grow and develop (if you want them).
Great and friendly environment. Very collaborative.
Customer centric. Company values to be proud of.
Dynamic environment. Able to quickly adapt and change processes.
cons: Limited parking due to being in the Cambridge Biomedical Campus

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A fantastic, supportive environment to work in.
pros:
I write this during COVID19 which has shown Abcam to be just as I expected, a supportive, action oriented, collaborative working environment working globally to support all sites. 
I have worked at several offices across the world for various companies, the office at Discovery Drive is fantastic thought out working space and the best I have been employed at. 
From a career perspective, I have already seen internal promotions and career progression within both commercial and scientific roles, there is also investment in training and development across the business.
cons: Car parking onsite is the only con. However, the walk from the local park and ride is good exercise and only takes 20 mins.

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Best company I've ever worked for by milws and I've workded for quite a lot!.
pros: Great people. Great benefits. Feel I'm making a difference. Caring. Doing some good in a bad world. Everybody is important.
cons: Wish I'd joined years ago!

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: Fantastic, great vision, brilliant people.
pros:
From the day I started, I have felt welcomed, by the company as a whole, and by the people and functions I'm working directly with. 

All of the exec leadership team are incredibly approachable, and so are the functional leaders and managers. There is no feeling of hierarchy or that you can't say what you really think in meetings or at lunch or wherever. In fact peoples' opinions are genuinely welcomed and if people have a different opinion there is a culture of discussing it from both perspectives. It's very refreshing.

So far in my first 3 months I've not seen any cross-functional fighting; everyone is very used to discussing challenges in an open way - maybe because there are lots of scientists there is a very collaborative vibe. 

I also like the way employees are treated as people; there are lots of extra-curricular activities and adhoc groups you can join. 

Finally the workforce is I would say relatively young, but even old fogeys like me are welcomed :)
cons: None really. I'm really glad I made the move

location: Cambridge, East of England, England, England
headline: A great company so far

This is apparent from the way in which they manage, communicate and support their employees through challenging situations i.e Covid19 through to the fluid review of everyone's learning and personal development. In my experience it is a friendly, positive, transparent and collaborative workplace. Communication channels are very much open, with a platform to easily ask Alan (CEO) questions. Abcam also has a flexible working policy which is a great enabler for managing the balance of work/life but also promotes a diverse employee base.

headline: A great organisation with lots to do

The structures change a lot and sometimes there are too many managers.

headline: Can't beat it

This is a successful business, growing fast around the world. It CARES for its people; looking after everyone through the COVID-19 period with full flexibility, keeping everyone employed and no furlough. Also gave everyone (who performed) pay increases. It has an amazing stock plan designed to share the success of the company with its people around the world. Super generous! Join if you like growing.
